You mean one: him. And later on, spambots.

You should seriously consider if you really need to make a forum. Seriously. Especially since DooM isn't all that popular anymore and has all the communities it needs.

Your forum will fail, I can tell in advance. Especially since you made one on a dying forum system (ezBoard). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: I can see it now
content:
Ah. In the Battle for Wesnoth forums, a guy named Troy started his own forum... acting a fairly similar way this guy acts. It was a total chaos. Someone hijacked it soon... it got abandoned...

All in all, you need some expertise to start forums, for example, achieving a moderator rank in an old forum such as this. Otherwise, you're just stepping on thin ice; and the cold water below will freeze and kill you quickly, believe me.

EDIT: May I know how did I come with such a poetic paragraph so quickly, with no intention of doing so? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oops.gif[/img] ------------------------------

content: If the forum moves, they could always add some extra code to change the smilies theme (in addition to the forum theme). That way, if you like the classic, pixel-ly ones, or if you like cleaner, hi-res ones, you'll still get what you want.-Genius314
